titleStmt.title: Mary Butler v. Adam Craig. Defendant's Bill of Exceptions

bibl.title: Defendant's Bill of Exceptions
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div2.p:
Mary Butler agt William
Adam Craig

The Defendant by his and read in Evidence to the Record and proceedings and Judgment of Appeals, on a petition filed by William Mary Butler the Father and Mother of the present petitioner (here insert the whole Record) and prayed the opinion of the Court that the said Judgment rendered in the provincial Court of Appeals was a good and sufficient Bar against the present petitioner, and sufficient to preclude her from any Relief on her present petition But the Court were of opinion that in no case a Judgment against the parents of persons claiming Freedom, which Judgment determined the parents should be Slaves, was a Bar against any of their Children to prevent them the said Record Proceedings and Judgment were no Bar to prevent the petitioner from claiming and having her Freedom. To which opinion of the Court the Defendant by his Counsel prayed Leave to except, and to appeal therefrom which was granted &c
